page.title: 02SHIPBUILDING IN PORT GLASGOW
page.content: When the shipbuilding industry was established on the Lower Clyde, the majority of the male population of Port Glasgow were employed in this industry. As the years progressed, and after flourishing, the industry experienced a distinct decline, due to the lack of,and more recently the late completion of orders. The revelation of the unfinished Britoil Rig, revealed the attitudes of workers and management. The yard faced closure, and men faced redundancy and permanent unemployment. The inevitable happened and privatisation resulted. Work was available and the threat of mass unemployment was reduced for the time being, although many had been paid off. It didn't last, as in May 1985 more redundancies were taken. The situation deteriorated. Some people blame the Government others the Unions
